Understate: The claim understates the fact that many signers of the Declaration of Independence had prior elected office experience.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is evidence that contradicts it, such as the list of signers who had held elective office before joining the Continental Congress.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that having no federal elected office experience was a common characteristic among all signers of the Declaration of Independence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that while some signers may not have had federal elected office experience, they still had prior experience in other elected offices.
